cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 220 miles SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest tonight, then north-northwest on Monday and north on Tuesday, passing over western Cuba, entering the eastern Gulf of Mexico, and then curving toward the Florida west coast before crossing the peninsula and approaching the Georgia/South Carolina coast late in the work-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Cuba (Isla de Juventud / Pinar del Río area), then Florida west coast (near Tampa Bay) mid-week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch – lower Florida Keys from Seven Mile Bridge southward to Key West including Dry Tortugas; Little Cayman and Cayman Brac
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning – Grand Cayman and Cuban provinces of Isla de Juventud, Pinar del Río, Artemisa; Tropical Storm Warning – Cuban provinces of La Habana, Mayabeque, Matanzas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Cayman Islands, Florida Keys and peninsula, eastern Gulf coast, and later Georgia–South Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 34–45 kt) possible late Thursday into Friday with 27% cumulative chance; 8% chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of roughly 2–4 ft above ground possible along the southeast Georgia coast and in the Savannah River entrance late Thursday–Friday, depending on exact track and tide timing.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands could deliver 3–6 inches (locally higher) Thursday–Friday, producing urban and river flooding near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Strong rip currents, hazardous seas, and potential river flooding could disrupt vessel traffic and cargo handling operations.
